# Grouped bubble graph {#sec-grouped-bubble-charts} ::: {.callout-tip appearance='simple' icon=false} ***This graph is largely complete and just needs final proof reading.*** ::: :::: {.callout-note collapse="false" icon=false}
::: {.cell layout-align="right"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](grouped_bubble_charts_files/figure-html/full_code_display-1.png){fig-align='right' width=60% height=60%} ::: ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.10em; color: #02577A;"} **This graph requires:** ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.05em; color: #282b2d;"} **✅ a categorical variable** ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.05em; color: #282b2d;"} **✅ two numeric (continuous) variables** ::: :::: ## Description Grouped bubble graphs use position, color, and size to display the relationships between four variables (three numerical/quantitative, one categorical). The position on the x and y axis captures the relationship between two numerical variables. The size and color of the points display a third numerical variable across the levels of a (fourth) categorical variable. ## Set up ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **PACKAGES:** ::: Install packages. ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} install.packages("palmerpenguins") library(palmerpenguins) library(ggplot2) ``` ::: ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **DATA:** ::: ::: {.column-margin} ![Artwork by allison horst](www/lter_penguins.png){fig-align="right" width="100%" height="100%"} ::: The `penguins` data. ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} penguins <- palmerpenguins::penguins glimpse(penguins) #> Rows: 344 #> Columns: 8 #> $ species Adelie, Adelie, Adelie… #> $ island Torgersen, Torgersen, … #> $ bill_length_mm 39.1, 39.5, 40.3, NA, … #> $ bill_depth_mm 18.7, 17.4, 18.0, NA, … #> $ flipper_length_mm 181, 186, 195, NA, 193… #> $ body_mass_g 3750, 3800, 3250, NA, … #> $ sex male, female, female, … #> $ year 2007, 2007, 2007, 2007… ``` ::: ::: ## Grammar ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **CODE:** ::: - Create labels with `labs()` - Initialize the graph with `ggplot()` and provide `data` - Map `bill_length_mm` to the `x` axis and `flipper_length_mm` to the `y` axis - Inside `geom_point()` - map `body_mass_g` to `size` and `species` to `fill` - set the `alpha` to `2/3` - In the `scale_size()` - set `range` to `c(.04, 6)` ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} labs_grp_bubble <- labs( title = "Bill Length vs. Flipper Length", x = "Bill Length (mm)", y = "Flipper length (mm)", size = "Body Mass", fill = "Species") ggp2_grp_bubble <- penguins |> ggplot(aes( x = bill_length_mm, y = flipper_length_mm)) + geom_point( aes(size = body_mass_g, color = species), alpha = 2/3) + scale_size(range = c(.04, 6)) ggp2_grp_bubble + labs_grp_bubble ``` ::: ::: ::: {style="font-size: 1.15em; color: #1e83c8;"} **GRAPH:** ::: ::: {.cell .column-page-inset-right layout-nrow="1"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](grouped_bubble_charts_files/figure-html/create_graph_grp_bubble-1.png){width=100% height=100%} ::: ::: ## More info We can change the `shape` of the points for more control of the `color` and `fill`. ### Shape Inside `geom_point()`, we can set `shape` to `21`, and `color` to `"#000000"` to outline the points in black ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell .column-page-inset-right layout-nrow="1"} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} ggp2_grp_bubble_s21 <- penguins |> ggplot(aes( x = bill_length_mm, y = flipper_length_mm)) + geom_point( aes(size = body_mass_g, fill = species), alpha = 2/3, shape = 21, color = "#000000") + scale_size(range = c(.04, 6)) ggp2_grp_bubble_s21 + labs_grp_bubble ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](grouped_bubble_charts_files/figure-html/shape_21-1.png){width=100% height=100%} ::: ::: ::: ### Color Inside the `aes()` of `geom_point()`, we can set `shape` to `21`, and map `color` to `"species"` to outline the points in the same colors as `fill` ::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"} ::: {.cell .column-page-inset-right layout-nrow="1"} ```{.r .cell-code code-fold="show"} ggp2_grp_bubble_s21_color <- penguins |> ggplot(aes( x = bill_length_mm, y = flipper_length_mm)) + geom_point( aes(size = body_mass_g, fill = species, color = species), alpha = 2/3, shape = 21) + scale_size(range = c(.04, 6)) ggp2_grp_bubble_s21_color + labs_grp_bubble ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](grouped_bubble_charts_files/figure-html/shape_21_color_aes-1.png){width=100% height=100%} ::: ::: :::
